pr_body:
On clicking the custom option in the sort dropdown, the user can select from and to dates and user is then displayed the posts within that date range.

Fixes #11223 <!--(<=== Add issue number here)-->

Screenshots:
Before selecting date range /tag/three consists of 4 posts (total posts).
After selecting the date range, one post is displayed:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78212650/175647708-94c834eb-e7ed-492b-be8f-667fa761596a.png)

pr_body:
<!-- Add a short description about your changes here-->
Added following date validations for the datepicker:
1. From date should be on or before today
2. To date should be on or before today
3. From and to dates should form a valid date range

Fixes #11296 <!--(<=== Add issue number here)-->

Video:


https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78212650/180331355-9a1a4187-80fc-4eec-8d81-1c1e33147664.mp4

pr_title: Fixes #11203: Refined Information hierarchy on profile page
pr_body:
Fetched posts on the profile page only by the user, rather than dispalying activity of the user on a particular post.

Fixes #11203 <!--(<=== Add issue number here)-->

### Screenshots

Before:

[{'comment_id': 903626763, 'comment_body': 'Use the return of the conditional for variable assignment and comparison.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 22, 11, 35, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'codeclimate[bot]', 'type': 'Bot'}, {'comment_id': 903745828, 'comment_body': "Hi @KarishmaVanwari, this looks great! I was thinking instead of duplicating the code in the if-else clauses, we could use `nil` as the default value of `author_id` and Rails will know not to include that argument in the query.

Here's the [Rails docs](https://apidock.com/rails/ActiveRecord/QueryMethods/where#:~:text=blank%20condition,the%20current%20relation.) for that.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 22, 13, 29, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'TildaDares', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 903994749, 'comment_body': 'On it!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 22, 16, 32, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KarishmaVanwari', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 905211863, 'comment_body': "@KarishmaVanwari This was a mistake on my part. The solution I suggested would search for nodes that had `uid = NULL`. This should return a better result:

Add these two new lines at the beginning of the method:
```ruby
query = {status: 1, type: type}
query['uid'] = author_id unless author_id.blank? 
```

And then pass the variable `query` as the only argument in the where query.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 23, 16, 4, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'TildaDares', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 905328188, 'comment_body': 'Done! @TildaDares ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 23, 18, 15, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KarishmaVanwari', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 905328727, 'comment_body': 'Space inside { missing.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 23, 18, 15, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'codeclimate[bot]', 'type': 'Bot'}, {'comment_id': 905328732, 'comment_body': 'Space inside } missing.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 23, 18, 15, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'codeclimate[bot]', 'type': 'Bot'}, {'comment_id': 905375827, 'comment_body': 'All tests are passing now!!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 23, 19, 16, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'TildaDares', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 906065892, 'comment_body': 'Yes! Thank you so much @TildaDares!!!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 24, 13, 29, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KarishmaVanwari', 'type': 'User'}]

[{'comment_id': 908414364, 'comment_body': 'Trailing whitespace detected.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 28, 12, 24, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'codeclimate[bot]', 'type': 'Bot'}, {'comment_id': 908414369, 'comment_body': 'Put empty method definitions on a single line.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 28, 12, 24, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'codeclimate[bot]', 'type': 'Bot'}, {'comment_id': 908539690, 'comment_body': "This is great. OK, so let's merge this, get some feedback, and while we're talking through the visual side with folks, we can work on generating these lists programmatically with Ruby. My guess is we'll start with the top-level topics hard-coded, like:

```ruby
[
  'agriculture',
  'air-quality'
]
```
Then we'll make up a new method in the tag controller that returns `@child_tags`. Calculating that will be a little harder - we'll look for all the wiki pages with the `parent:______` tag, and then return all of their `slug` values (i.e. the short string corresponding with a tagname). So for `water-quality` we'd return `@child_tags` of a list of any wiki page slugs where the wiki page has the tag `parent:water-quality`. Does that make sense?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 28, 14, 16, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jywarren', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 908660947, 'comment_body': "Yup @jywarren, this makes a little sense to me. 

> My guess is we'll start with the top-level topics hard-coded, like:


Where would this be hard-coded?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 28, 16, 1, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KarishmaVanwari', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 961658827, 'comment_body': 'Sorry! OK, so we moved part of this to here: https://github.com/publiclab/plots2/pull/11380, where we are setting up a way to request the sub-topics. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 2, 13, 4, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jywarren', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 961662193, 'comment_body': "Ah, here, could we make it completely parametric, that is, could we say, if it matches ANY tag listed in the LINKS file, could we display it? It might be something like:

```ruby
if LINKS.keys.include?(tag.name)
```

I'm not 100% sure that would work, but something like it? Also, this is in the mini cards, i haven't seen that yet... would you mind adding a screenshot? Thank you! I thought the previous location had been in the upper right corner next to the wiki edit button, but this sounds interesting too!", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 2, 13, 8, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jywarren', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 961666985, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
  microscopes: https://store.publiclab.org/products/microscope
  microscope: https://store.publiclab.org/products/microscope
  infragram: https://store.publiclab.org/products/infragram-diy-filter-pack
  baby-legs: https://store.publiclab.org/products/babylegs
  infragram-pi: https://store.publiclab.org/products/infragram-pi-camera
  infragram: https://store.publiclab.org/products/infragram-diy-filter-pack
  simple-air-sensor: https://store.publiclab.org/products/simple-air-sensor
  pi-camera: https://store.publiclab.org/products/raspberry-pi-camera
  spectrometer: https://store.publiclab.org/products/lego-spectrometer-kit
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 2, 13, 14, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jywarren', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 961667194, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 2, 13, 14, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'jywarren', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 962190069, 'comment_body': '> ```ruby
> if LINKS.keys.include?(tag.name)
> ```


@jywarren 
This code did not work, but I figured this out by first checking if such a key exists and if so, checking if the sub-key exists using this:

```ruby
if LINKS.has_key?("tags") && LINKS["tags"].has_key?(tag.name)
```

It works now and looks like this - 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/78212650/188283947-089252a3-3c7b-4107-8430-fa673fc0a52b.png)

', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 3, 18, 39, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'KarishmaVanwari', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Added tooltip on `first-time-poster` tag to highlight that it is added by default when a note is posted.
